title: NYC comptroller says jail reform not moving fast enough
text:
NEW YORK (AP) - New York City Comptroller Scott Stringer says Mayor Bill de Blasio hasn't moved aggressively enough to reform city jails, where violence and costs have increased even as the inmate population has declined.
Stringer says the city correction department is "pouring huge amounts of money" into reducing violent incidents at the jails without seeing results.
Stringer said in a report released by his office Friday that the jail population is at its lowest in 31 years.
But both assaults by inmates on staff and allegations of use of force by staff on inmates increased in fiscal year 2015 compared to the prior year.
The annual cost per inmate rose 17 percent to $112,665 in fiscal year 2015.
De Blasio spokeswoman Monica Klein said in a statement that "meaningful reform takes time."
